Yes, placing importance on merit-based promotions helps to ensure that the most qualified and capable officers are promoted to leadership positions. This, in turn, helps to develop and maintain a strong and professional leadership cadre within the Indian Army.

By promoting officers based on their performance and ability rather than just their seniority, the Indian Army ensures that officers have the necessary skills and experience to lead their units effectively. Merit-based promotions also promote healthy competition among officers, encouraging them to strive for excellence in their professional pursuits, ultimately leading to the overall improvement of the organization.

Moreover, merit-based promotions also help to ensure that the Indian Army remains competitive and effective in today's rapidly changing global security environment. As a result, the Indian Army remains one of the most professional and capable military organizations globally.
